message: I'm looking at a URL that gives me a redirect (code 302) and what I really want is the Location header that is returned. The http:get function will just follow the redirect and return the resulting page.
I'd like a new function: http:head(url) that doesn't follow redirects.
is there are KRL SDK?
That reminds me that if we want a pure KRL module for couchdb we'd also need http:put and http:delete
KRL modules are the SDK. We are talking about supporting all HTTP verbs soon.
That's a good news. What do you mean by engine?
Okay, so you don't plan to allow developing KRL functions in perl in the future?
we will when we open source it, but it will require running your own engine.
you know. Like the kind in cars.
@loic Means that you'll have to install the KNS backend
and the KNS backend will be open source too ?
yes, it will. Keep in mind that running your own makes clustering and scaling to loadyour problem, instead of ours. :)
really happy we will be able to install a local platform. Can we expect a release this summer?
yes. The engine is a perl based apache module, so be prepared to run some foundation code.
What is foundation code?
the first thing i'll code though is a bridge to node.js
and I don't care it's not possible.
what bridge do you want to exist?
It could be something that allows to run code inside nodejs and get the result in KRL in the prelude ( and this mechanism could be used for other languages too )
or it could be some "raise explicit event on nodejs"
Fork?
I meant this convore thread. Not so much about http:head any more.
I hope not.
Ok  => https://convore.com/kynetx/kynetx-open-source/
